intro: Pedicularis densispica subsp. viridescens, commonly known as the green-stem lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is a relatively rare and specialized species.
